page.title: 17Shops in Paulerspury
page.content:
The post office is housed in a 30-year- old wooden building in Plumpton End. The Ballingers have been running it for the past fifteen years. As well as being a post office it also sells cigarettes, sweets, stationery, toys and some household goods.
At 25 High Street Mrs Pope runs a shop which was built in 1840. She has lived there for fifty-six years. She sells groceries, confectionary, tobacco, cigarettes, drinks and crisps.
Pury End Stores is in Lower Street. It was built in 1961 and sells many things the village needs - groceries, frozen foods, fruit, vegetables, ice cream, newspapers, magazines, Calor gas, coal, sweets and cigarettes. There is also a post office in the shop.
